text: there are fancy French macaroons or
mackerel and then there are chocolate
coconut macaroons I've taken the best
parts of each one put them together and
come up with something new so what I
love about the chocolate coconut
macaroons is that fudge equality and
what I love about the light French
macaroons is the almond flavor so what I
have right here in this bowl is I have
both I have almond flour with some cocoa
powder some confectioner sugar a little
salt and then over here I've got egg
whites and I'm just gonna beat them with
some sugar see that nice little peak
that's what we're looking for so I have
my beaten egg whites I'm just gonna fold
the dry mixture into here and I'm gonna
do that a little at a time so I don't
deflate the whites that's a stiff egg
white you want to take your time with
this because you really don't want to
lose that air all that air that you've
beaten into the whites that's what's
gonna give the macaroons their rise this
is done when it looks like brownie
batter I'm gonna make it easy for myself
and I'm gonna use this plastic bag and
I'm gonna pipe them for you people with
pastry bags go ahead and use your pastry
bag so here's a trick put one corner in
the bottom of a glass like that and you
put everything in here and it's so much
less messy mmm no I'm just gonna snip
the end and you want to do about an inch
apart maybe a little more once you have
them all forum you want to leave the
macaroons at room temperature for 30
minutes and this is a really important
step so don't skip it because what
happens is they kind of dry out they
form a little bit of a crust and it
keeps them from falling in when they
bake and it makes them a little bit
crunchy and then you bake them they're
ready you could serve them just as they
are or you could drizzle some chocolate
on them and they'd be delicious but I
came up with this recipe as a Passover
dessert after a seder so I wanted them
to be even more special so what I'm
gonna do is cook sugar down to a caramel
sandwich the caramel in between the
cookies and then put bittersweet
chocolate on top
at this point once it starts to turn
color it's gonna go really quickly so
you want to kind of swirl the pan a
little bit just so it's even I always
say when it's the color of an Irish
setter that's when it's ready sort of
that ready dark red color once the
caramel is ready work fast have all your
cookies turned over and then you're just
gonna spoon it out it's okay if it drips
and now I'm gonna make sandwiches real
fast ready as a last step that you could
skip by the way cuz these are great on
their own I've just huddled these
cookies together so that most of the
chocolate gets on the cookies not on the
parchment once the macaroons are set
they will keep for a few days at room
temperature and there you have it three
different kinds of macaroons metal
macaroons and fabulous caramel candy
chocolatey yumminess
